history.content: Personally I've never done a data science interview (just a couple of data science / analytics coding challenges) so please take my experience with a grain of salt. I've noticed a slight difference between the data science and analytics positions in that data science positions have included more questions about SQL / R while analytics positions have focused more on statistics, creating visualizations from excel data, and providing advice to the company based on transaction data / history. I think it really does depend on the position you're interviewing for and what languages + skills they mention in the job description because that's what's going to be tested in the coding challenge and interview e.g. if SQL is mentioned, expect at least one challenging SQL question to show up. Regarding resources for a DS interview, have you checked out this list: https://towardsdatascience.com/the-big-list-of-ds-ml-interview-resources-2db4f651bd63?

children.subject: +1 to this, I've also been asked leetcode style questions in a few of the technical portions so I'd prep for those, in addition to the op here. There's also the occasional take home projects that are similar to the types of projects done in 189 (and stat 154/info 159) where you're given some data and asked to build a model to answer a few questions (usually business related)
My data science interviews have mostly been ML problems on feature engineering, modeling, model/algo evaluation, etc., which 189 definitely prepares you for.

history.content:
Hi, I’m a junior cs/ds double major who’s looking for summer internships. I’ve taken ee126/ee127/170 and am currently self learning data 100 this winter break and am signed up for cs 189 for next semester. I’m leaning more towards data science and wondering how to prepare for data science internship interviews? I know for software there is leetcode and all these books but there’s not that many resources for data science interviews.

Thank you
history.subject: Data science internship interviews
